intro: Viola grandiflora subsp. ramosa, commonly known as the ramose violet, is a herbaceous perennial native to the eastern United States. It features heart-shaped, velvety leaves with a deep green color and distinctive violet flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 cm, with branched stems that support its showy, five-petaled flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. The subspecies is characterized by its more robust growth habit compared to other viola species.
